haskell-gtd-nl.extension.disable-local-d.description: If HLS is active, this extension's local definitions will be disabled, as they are often out of sync with HLS (meaning you would see two definitions for local symbols). Does not affect behavior for symbols resolved outside of current working directory.

haskell-gtd-nl.server.path.description: Path to the `haskell-gtd-nl-server` executable. The relative path is resolved relative to the extension's root directory. In case there's none, `$PATH`, `~/.local/bin` and `~/.cabal/bin` are searched.

haskell-gtd-nl.parser.path.description: Path to the `haskell-gtd-nl-parser` executable. Behaves in a similar way to `haskell-gtd-nl.server.path`.

haskell-gtd-nl.server.args.description: Arguments to pass to the `haskell-gtd-nl-server` executable. Check `haskell-gtd-nl-server --help` for more information.

haskell-gtd-nl.parser.args.description: Arguments to pass to the `haskell-gtd-nl-parser` executable. Check `haskell-gtd-nl-parser --help` for more information. The server passes those arguments to the parser before all the arguments the server wants to pass to the parser.

commands.title: haskell-gtd-nl: kill/stop backend server (it will be restarted automatically when a Haskell file is opened)
haskell-gtd-nl: applies `cpphs` to the current file. Useful for debugging.

scripts.vscode:prepublish: yarn run compile; yarn run package
scripts.pretest: yarn run compile && yarn run lint
